column4: someone explain this to me: http://pastebin.com/ZSNrbjVa (no firewalls blocking or intercepting - all other machinces work fine on the network)
is the router connected to the internet and the internet link lights showing up?
what type of connection is it wired/wireless? what is the error you are getting when connecting?
what response comes from ping?
can you pastebin "sudo ethtool eth0" . replacing eth0 with your wired interface?
hmm
i've seen oddities
running f/w software or hardware of any kind?
traceroute -n 4.2.2.2 and paste it please
ok
and we are sure the subnet is correct i see you statically assigned your self?
also can i see "arp -a ?"
what type of connection is this? ISP wise?
cable/fiber/dialup/dsl?
did you see your router h/w address in arp -a?
what is the result of "sudo ip link show && sudo ip addr show; sudo arp -a"
anything on those commands output?
is 192.168.1.131 the other host on the network which 'works' ?
interesting
can you try this possibly.. the auto line... make it like this "#"
auto lo eth0 <--this is how my interfaces is setup
have you also tried to  remove "network 192.168.1.0" line?
